_header: A blissful life a peaceable and a sweet
Note:
Cf. Pace (1961)
XPace, George B. “The True Text of ‘The Former Age.’” Mediaeval Studies 23 (1961): 363-7.
_description: Chaucer, The Former Age [Aetas Prima] — eight 8-line stanzas

CULHh412.First Lines:
A blisful lyfe a peseable and a sweteleddyn the peplis in the
                    former age…
CULHh412.Last Lines:
…Dowblenesse treson and enuyePoysonne manslawtyr mordre
                        and enuye in sondre wyse
CULHh412.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             A Parallel-Text Edition of Chaucer’s Minor Poems.
             3 vols. 
             Chaucer Society
         1st. ser. 21, 57, 58. London: Trübner, n.d. repr. New York and
            London: Johnson, 1967.

CULIi321.First Lines:
A Blysful lyf a paysyble & a sweteledden the poeples in the
                    former age…
CULIi321.Last Lines:
…dowblenesse & tresoun & enuyepoyson & manslawhtre
                    & mordre in sondry wyse
CULIi321.Attributed Title:
Chawcer vp on this fyfte meter of the second book (f.
                    52v)
CULIi321.Editions:
